title: Simple past or present perfect tense exercise

questions.question: His father ............................... last year.
questions.description: When there is a definite past time reference we use the simple past tense.

questions.question: James ........................................ school at fourteen.
questions.description: When there is a definite past time reference we use the simple past tense.

questions.question: I .................................. him for ten years.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present we use the present perfect tense.

questions.question: I ................................. all of her novels.
questions.description: When there is no definite time reference we use the present perfect tense.

questions.question: You .................................... me for anything.
questions.description: When there is no definite time reference we use the present perfect tense.

questions.question: I .................................... a strange experience last night.
questions.description: When there is a definite past time reference, we use the simple past tense.

questions.question: Suddenly I .................................. a knock on the door.
questions.description: We use the simple past tense to simply state that something happened in the past.

questions.question: There ................................ no one to rescue the child.
questions.description: We use the simple past tense to state that something happened or didn't happen in the past.

questions.question: The fox .................................. to eat the bunch of grapes hanging from the vine.
questions.description: We use the simple past tense to say that something happened in the past.

questions.question: This castle ................................... in the 16th century.
questions.description: When there is a definite past time reference we use the simple past tense.

questions.question: I ................................... pity for the poor beggar.
questions.description: We use the simple past tense to say that something happened in the past.

questions.question: You .................................... for the grand finale.
questions.description: When there is no definite time reference we use the present perfect tense.
